MS MCQs

    Manage Azure updates

    »

    1. Contoso IT has a WSUS deployment to update their on-premises servers. Which of the following statements about WSUS with Update Management is true?

      Contoso cannot use WSUS in addition to using Azure Update Management.

      Contoso can configure the Specify intranet Microsoft Update service location value in Group Policy to point their servers to the appropriate WSUS server.

      There’s no need to approve updates with WSUS if you’re using Update Management.


    2. In addition to an Automation account, what else must Contoso enable to enable Update Management?

      In addition to the Automation account, Contoso IT staff must enable a Log Analytics workspace.

      In addition to the Automation account, Contoso IT staff must install the Log Analytics agent on all VMs.

      In addition to the Automation account, Contoso IT staff must enable WSUS to deploy updates to on-premises servers.


    3. When Contoso IT support staff decide to deploy updates using Update Management, they create an Update Deployment. They want to deploy the updates to only a subset of servers being managed by Update Management. How could they do this?

      Contoso staff must configure Groups to update and manually add the appropriate servers to those group.

      Contoso staff must configure Groups to update and create a query to dynamically add the appropriate servers to those groups.

      Contoso staff must use the Include/exclude updates value to define which servers to include.
